str2: Wherefore, on which account, therefore. From dia and hos; through which thing, i.e. Consequently.

parse: Verb - Present Participle Active - Nominative Masculine Plural
str2: From para and lambano; to receive near, i.e. Associate with oneself; by analogy, to assume an office; figuratively, to learn.
From basileus; properly, royalty, i.e. rule, or a realm.

parse: Verb - Present Subjunctive Active - 1st Person Plural
str2: To have, hold, possess. Including an alternate form scheo skheh'-o; a primary verb; to hold.
From chairo; graciousness, of manner or act.
A primary preposition denoting the channel of an act; through.

parse: Verb - Present Subjunctive Active - 1st Person Plural
str2: To serve, especially God, perhaps simply: I worship. From latris; to minister, i.e. Render religious homage.
A deity, especially the supreme Divinity; figuratively, a magistrate; by Hebraism, very.
Acceptably, in a well-pleasing way. Adverb from euarestos; quite agreeably.
(a) gen: with, in company with, (b) acc: (1) behind, beyond, after, of place, (2) after, of time, with nouns, neut. of adjectives.
Reverence, fear of God, piety. From eulabes; properly, caution, i.e. reverence; by implication, dread.
Cowardly, timid, fearful. From deos; timid, i.e. faithless.
